fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-59999].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Issue Comment Notification not triggering if "Edit Screen" is used to add comment and only  Issue Updated Notification is triggering. 

Steps to Reproduce
# Log in to JIRA (outbound email must be working, )
# Select any existing JIRA issue that you reported  (Assign ticket to different user)
# Click on Edit and add any comment on below edit screen
# Click update 

Actual Results:
The assignee will receive an email notification that issue has been updated. 


h3. Suggested Solution
The assignee should receive both {{Issue Updated}} and {{Issue Commented}} notification emails if comment is added using {{edit screen}}.

 
h3. Workaround 
- When adding a comment in a issue, just use the "comment" button in issue screen.
fields.summary: Issue Comment Notification not triggering if "Edit Screen" is used to add comment

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-59998].
  {panel}

Currently full changelog is returned when using {{expand=changelog}} in {{/search}} or {{/issue}} endpoint. It may cause OOM easily. At least in JIRA Cloud such requests are killed with timeout error, quite often.

It would be much better if only 20 changelog entries were returned by {{/search}} or {{/issue}} enpoint, and new {{/issue/\{idOrKey\}/changelog}} endpoint would then return full history on request.

Note, this technique is used for worklog currently.

See also https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/316418/iterate-through-changelog-history-with-rest-api and https://bitbucket.org/azhdanov/jiratimesheet/issues/760/timesheet-report-gadget-generates-timeout
fields.summary: Limit changelog to 20 entries, and add /changelog endpoint for full history

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-59992].
  {panel}

*Problem Definition*
Currently in JIRA if users list issues according to the FixVersions, JIRA will be listing the Issues according to the Issue Key and after that according to FixVersions value. This is because versions are project specific and the sort order is defined by the arrangement of the project versions within the project configuration.

 !FixVersions ORDER Bug.png|thumbnail! 

*Suggested Solution*
Allow users to sort issues by Fix Versions value even though they are searching for issues from multiple projects.

*Workaround*
Currently there's no workaround for this.
fields.summary: List Issues in Issue Navigator according to FixVersions regardless of Issue Key

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-59991].
  {panel}

h4. +Summary+
In JIRA 7, it's possible that each Application uses a different User-tier for its license. It seems that an add-on license is always checked against the Application with the higher/highest User-tier.

h4. +Scenario+
# Install JIRA Software 7
# Use JIRA Software 10-user license
# Use JIRA Core 25-user license
# Install an add-on and use a 10-user license for it

The add-on can be configured to be used by only those users who have JIRA Software access, however this doesn't matter as the add-on license is checked against JIRA Core license, which makes it *incompatible*.

(i) The same behavior is observed when JIRA Software uses 25-user license and JIRA Core uses 10-user license.

h4. +Suggestion+
Since this seems to be the way UPM has always checked for add-on licenses, it should be well documented somewhere. This is necessary in JIRA 7, where each application can use a different user-tier.

(!) Another suggestion may be to make it possible for an add-on to only work with one specific application, against which its license is checked.
fields.summary: Document how Add-on license is checked when there are multiple Applications with different User-tiers

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-59990].
  {panel}

*Issue Summary*
When a user wants to find all tickets that were last updated by a specific user, using JQL, they would realize that JIRA has no feature to accomplish this as the updated parameter finds all ticket that were recently updated but not necessarily by the user.

*Feature Request*
Can a feature that gets who made the last comment or change from the history section be added so that users can then have a field like {{lastchangeby}} to use to filter the issues better?
fields.summary: Add a feature that allows retrieving issues last updated by a specific user

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When a user tries to setup JIRA by pointing the instance to an Existing JIRA database. An error is show as below:
 !SetupDatabase71.png|thumbnail! 

This link points to: {{https://docs.atlassian.com/jira/jadm-docs-071/Connecting+JIRA+to+a+Database#ConnectingJIRAtoaDatabase-UpgradingJIRAorMigratingJIRAtoAnotherServer?}} which is a broken link. 

h3. Environment
JIRA 7.0 or JIRA 7.1

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Start up a new instance of JIRA 7
# Attempt to connect it to an existing Database.
# Observe the reported Error (expected)
# Click the link for more assistance. 

h3. Expected Results
The URL should direct the user to the correct documentation location: [Connecting JIRA applications to a database|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AdminJIRAServer071/Connecting+JIRA+applications+to+a+database]

h3. Actual Results
The user is pointed to the incorrect location, as a result of the change in the title of the Documentation.

h3. Notes
The correct URL Can be accessed by:  [Connecting JIRA applications to a database|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AdminJIRAServer071/Connecting+JIRA+applications+to+a+database]
fields.summary: Broken Link to Documentation on Database Setup page.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-59985].
  {panel}

h3. +Summary+
Currently, the Pie Chart on the Wallboard is displayed in a different format from that as a Dashboard Gadget. The latter is displayed as a doughnut but the former appears as a flat circle with labels, and the labels are too small.

h3. +Steps to reproduce+
# create a Dashboard and add a Pie Chart
(/) the chart is displayed as a doughnut:
!gadget.png|thumbnail!
# view the dashboard as Wallboard

h3. +Expected behavior+
The chart is still displayed as a doughnut

h3. +Actual behavior+
The chart is displayed as a flat circle with small labels (old layout):
!wallboard.png|thumbnail!

h3. +Suggestions+
It will be ideal if:
* user is able to customize the label size of the Wallboard Pie Chart
_OR_
* the Pie Chart format remains consistent on both Dashboard and Wallboard
fields.summary: Pie Chart Formats are not Consistent with Small Labels on Wallboard

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-59983].
  {panel}

When adding users to a JIRA instance that has less than five accounts not including the System Administrator account, the following form is presented to add users:

!presixusers.png|thumbnail!

This form does not allow you to opt out of the standard JIRA invite. Some customers do not want an invite sent. For example in cases where they want to manually add Service Desk customers so no invite is sent.

Instead, a customer should just see the following add user form:

!postsixusers.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Change form used to create users when six or less exist in User Management

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-59982].
  {panel}

When a user performs a search using status as a condition and saves it as a filter, if he deletes one of the statuses and then attempts to view the filter in Issue Navigator.

Users would be presented the following error:
{code}The value 'Terminate' does not exist for the field 'status'.{code}

Steps to replicate:
# Create a custom workflow and add in a custom Status {{Terminate}}
# Associate the Workflow with a project.
# Search for issues with status in (Resolved, Terminate, Close).
# Save a filter based on this.
# Associate a different workflow with the project.
# Delete or rename the status {{Terminate}}
# Go back to the search issue screen and select the filter you saved.

*Expected Result*
JIRA would ignore the status that is wrong and proceed to search for the other status conditions.

*Actual Result*
JIRA throws the error mentioned earlier.
fields.summary: JIRA Status Search Issue

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-59980].
{panel}
h3. Security information

The Webhooks component of Atlassian Jira before version 7.6.7 and from version 7.7.0 before version 7.11.0 allows remote attackers who are able to observe or otherwise intercept webhook events to learn information about changes in issues that should not be sent because they are not contained within the results of a specified JQL query.
h3. Summary

JQL filter for Webhooks dosn't work correctly when _Comment_ or _Worklog_ related events are fired.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an webhook as follows
 ** Issue related events
 *** JQL: {{project = <PROJECTKEY>}}
 *** Issue: created, updated
 *** Comment: created, updated
 *** Worklog: created,updated
 !webhooks.png|thumbnail!
 # Comment or log work on an issue in a project aside from the one which is specified with the JQL

h3. Expected Results

The webhook shouldn't be fired.
h3. Actual Results

The webhook was fired.
h3. Notes

When it comes to *NOT* "Comment" or "Worklog" related events (like creating issue, updating issue),
 the JQL filters the events correctly.
fields.summary: JQL filter for Webhooks doesn't work correctly when "Comment" and "Worklog" related events are fired - CVE-2017-18104

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Plugins cannot put keys or values in replicated caches that come from classes not accessible from webapp classloader, such as from the plugin classloader. This is what MyWork is doing with one of its replicated caches.

h3. Environment
JIRA Data Center
Workbox plugin *3.0.4*

# Install 2 nodes of JDC.
# Start them up.
# Use the JIRA instance as normal.

This works without any problems.

h3. Workaround

Disable the Workbox plugin(s):

* Workbox - Common Plugin
* Workbox - JIRA Provider Plugin

h3. Notes

It is also a spurious error that doesn't break cache replication, however does mean the plugin itself will not function as expected.

h5. Functionality
Workbox (MyWork) plugin is required to show notifications from JIRA in Confluence.
If you have enabled this functionality in Confluence, when you disable plugin in JIRA, Confluence users will not get notifications from JIRA anymore. 
See more details [Including notifications from JIRA|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Configuring+Workbox+Notifications]

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-59978].
  {panel}

On a JIRA Cloud instance, when you export searched issues to Excel, the column belonging to any date fields displays results in two different formats for the same column, depending on the month:

*dd/MMM/yyyy* (ie: 17/Jan/2016)
* January
* April
* August
* December

*dd/MM/yyyy* (ie: 15/02/2016)
* February
* March
* May
* June
* July
* September
* October
* November

It would be desirable to have them all in the same format, preferably yyyy-MM-dd (ie: 2016/01/23).
fields.summary: Mixed date formats exported to Excel. Update docs

fields.description:
When you do a "issue change" in JIRA via a workflow transition it fires the "IssueEvent" indicating that the change has happened inside the workflow transition transaction.

If an issue event listener reacts to this change and performs work on that issue in another thread then its a race condition between the originating transaction finishing and the other threads ability to read the new data

Depending on the will of the gods, you might read the previous issue state or the new issue state.

The JSD automation engine for example reacts to issue events but runs its rules in another thread (so as to not slow down the main web request)

The state of the issue is now indeterminate.  An event has been raised saying it has changed but the re-acting code may well read the issue as if it hasn't in fact changed.  And on the next run it might read it correctly has having changed.

This is a serious support problem.

This is not a problem for "direct issue edits" since the changed fields are stored inside the transaction and the "issue event" is raised outside the transaction do everything is deterministic.
fields.summary: Workflow issue changes raise their events inside the Transaction which breaks reacting applications

fields.description:
It's possible to create two versions with same name if you make two simultaneous requests to create version REST endpoint (POST {{/rest/api/latest/version}}) with same parameters.

It also might not work all time, but it shouldn't be hard to reproduce.

Code that lets you easily reproduce this issue is available here:
https://bitbucket.org/lexek/jira-version-bug-poc/src
fields.summary: Version REST endpoint allows creation of duplicate versions
Notification for just added watchers
Make Project selector field more readable

fields.description:
- Do an issue search. Use List view. See page A. 
- Click on an issue. See page B.
- Click on a linked issue under Issue links. See page C.
- Click Back in browser. See url change to url B. (Expected.) See page still being page C. (NOT expected; would expect page B to appear again.) 

When clicking Back again, you land at page A (the search) as expected. Reloading also gives you page B as expected. 

Steps to reproduce (issues below are chosen completely at random):  
- Go to https://jira.atlassian.com/issues/?jql=
- Search for: text ~"simpler embedded Crowd". Result is page A (https://jira.atlassian.com/issues/?jql=text%20~%22simpler%20embedded%20Crowd%22)
- Click USER-266 . See page B: https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/USER-266?jql=text%20~%22simpler%20embedded%20Crowd%22
- Click related link USER-79. See page C: https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/USER-79
- Click Back. Url does change but page doesn't reload.

First noticed in our Jira 6.4.9. Obviously also present in 7.1.0-rc3; see above. Tested with Explorer, Firefox, Safari.

Not a major issue - it's fairly noticeable which page you are on, and doesn't need a workaround, but you might want to fix it.

h3. Problem Definition

Existing Project Management projects do not have the new Core Kanban Boards, whereas new ones do. It would be good if we could add Core Boards to existing Core projects.

h3. Suggested Solution

Make it possible to add a board to an existing Core project.

Create a new project and move the issues from the old project to the new project.

h3. Summary
When specifying the project filter for Pie chart gadget, when you search for a project name, then JIRA will show the project with the project's key. However, the key repeats twice in the Pie Chart Gadget. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a pie chart on the dashboard
# On the *Project or Saved Filter* field type out the name of any project

h3. Expected Results
The project should display with its project key. Eg: {{new (NEWEE)}}

h3. Actual Results
However, the roject key is repeated twice. 
!twice.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Choosing a project in the Pie Chart Gadget will repeat the project's key twice

fields.description:
h3. Summary
For now if user would like to use JIRA in a language which is unavailable in JIRA, they can download language pack from https://translations.atlassian.com and install it and enable it system wide. However now the translation pack is not translating majority part of JIRA and only translating minor part of JIRA.

* Using in build language pack does translate words in JIRA.

h3. Environment
* JIRA 6.4.12, JIRA 7.0.5, JIRA 7.1.0

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Download any language pack from https://translations.atlassian.com
# Install the language pack in JIRA as add-on.
# Go to *General Configuration* and select the language installed from *Default language*

h3. Expected Results
JIRA is fully translated to the language selected

h3. Actual Results
Only minor part of JIRA is translated. Please refer to the screenshot below to see which part is translated.

 !Language1.jpg|thumbnail!

fields.description:
com.atlassian.jira.project.template.hook.ConfigureResponse#setRedirect is nonfunctional in JIRA 7.

I totally understand the API was deprecated (I expected to have some better way to specify this) but seems there's currently no way to tell in project blueprint which page should be opened once project is created.

We have a plugin that creates custom projects and to introduce users to the concepts we use we want to show them a nice welcome page when we on board them.

I don't understand why this option was removed.
fields.summary: It's not possible to redirect user to a custom page once project is created

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-59949].
  {panel}

Hey there,
This might sound like a trivial thing  (well in fact I think it is) but I just wanted to let you know the following: As you know, it is possible to link confluence pages to jira issues by using the "Confluence Page" feature. We noticed that you're also able to search for blog posts. 
This leads to the attached misery. We got this going for us by using the common "Web Link" interface. 

In conclusion, I think that you either shouldn't be able to find blogposts in the Confluence Page interface, or if so, blogposts aren't properly rendered by Jira.

Just wanted to point this out :)

Have a nice day
fields.summary: Linking Blogposts to Jira Issues

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-59948].
{panel}
Right now, JIRAs REST API for project creation (see [REST create Project |https://docs.atlassian.com/jira/REST/latest/#api/2/project-createProject]) does not allow to configure the IssueTypeSchme to be used nor the WorkflowScheme ...

The following overview illustrates this:
||REST Create Project attribute||supported||
|issueSecurityScheme|(/) can be set|
|permissionScheme|(/) can be set|
|notificationScheme|(/) can be set|
|workflowScheme|(/) can be set (Jira 8.6+)|
|issueTypeScheme|(x) can not be set|
|issueScreenScheme|(x) can not be set|

In order to be able to fully automate project setup it would be beneficial to be able to configure these aspects too.
fields.summary: JIRA REST API: create project should allow to set / configure IssueTypeScheme and WorkflowScheme too

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Performing a {{FixVersion = XYZ}} or {{AffectVersion = XYZ}} search without a project is very slow on instances with a lot of versions.
JIRA tries to load and show all unarchived versions in all visible to user projects. 

h3. Environment
* Tested on JIRA 7.0.9 and 6.4.13
* ~20,000+ versions
* ~600+ projects

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Open JQL search link on fixVersion in a new tab

h3. Expected Results
It executes fast

h3. Actual Results
It takes 28 seconds, at some large instances it can take minutes.

Thread dump shows thread busy doing {{filterVersions}} in {{getAllVersionsForProjects}} method:
{code}
"http-bio-8080-exec-10" #157 daemon prio=5 os_prio=0 tid=0x00007f4b680c3000 nid=0x3c7 runnable [0x00007f4fedb78000]
   java.lang.Thread.State: RUNNABLE
        at com.google.common.collect.Iterators$5.hasNext(Iterators.java:543)
        at com.google.common.collect.Iterators$5.hasNext(Iterators.java:543)
        at com.google.common.collect.Iterators$5.hasNext(Iterators.java:543)

        <repeated 180 times...>

        at com.google.common.collect.Iterators$5.hasNext(Iterators.java:543)
        at com.google.common.collect.Iterators$5.next(Iterators.java:550)
        at com.google.common.collect.Iterators$5.next(Iterators.java:554)
....
        at com.google.common.collect.Iterators$5.next(Iterators.java:554)
        at com.google.common.collect.Iterators$7.computeNext(Iterators.java:648)
        at com.google.common.collect.AbstractIterator.tryToComputeNext(AbstractIterator.java:143)
        at com.google.common.collect.AbstractIterator.hasNext(AbstractIterator.java:138)
        at com.google.common.collect.Lists.newArrayList(Lists.java:138)
        at com.google.common.collect.Lists.newArrayList(Lists.java:119)
        at com.atlassian.jira.project.version.DefaultVersionManager.filterVersions(DefaultVersionManager.java:522)
        at com.atlassian.jira.project.version.DefaultVersionManager.getAllVersionsForProjects(DefaultVersionManager.java:674)
        at com.atlassian.jira.issue.search.searchers.renderer.AbstractVersionRenderer.getValidOptions(AbstractVersionRenderer.java:150)
        at com.atlassian.jira.issue.search.searchers.renderer.AbstractVersionRenderer.getValidOptions(AbstractVersionRenderer.java:37)
        at com.atlassian.jira.issue.search.searchers.renderer.AbstractProjectConstantsRenderer.getOptions(AbstractProjectConstantsRenderer.java:122)
        at com.atlassian.jira.issue.search.searchers.renderer.AbstractProjectConstantsRenderer.addEditParameters(AbstractProjectConstantsRenderer.java:114)
        at com.atlassian.jira.issue.search.searchers.renderer.AbstractProjectConstantsRenderer.getEditHtml(AbstractProjectConstantsRenderer.java:102)
        at com.atlassian.jira.components.query.DefaultSearcherService.getEditHtml(DefaultSearcherService.java:473)
        at com.atlassian.jira.components.query.DefaultSearcherService.getValueResults(DefaultSearcherService.java:259)
        at com.atlassian.jira.components.query.DefaultSearcherService.getSearchResults(DefaultSearcherService.java:180)
        at com.atlassian.jira.components.query.DefaultSearcherService.searchWithJql(DefaultSearcherService.java:174)
        at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
...
{code}


h3. Notes
* It seems to cache something locally because if you hit the search button, it comes back fast. But if you reload the page, it takes 28 seconds.
* Scope of the problem: when _searchRenderer_ is implementing _AbstractVersionRenderer_, eg. _AffectedVersionRenderer_ , _FixForVersionRenderer_, _VersionPickerCustomFieldRenderer_:

h3.Workaround
Use project in JQL search

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-59929].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
JIRA Administration > Applications > Versions & Licenses. JIRA Core displays a message that an upgrade is available, but there isn't a similar message for either JIRA Service Desk or JIRA Software. This is especially confusing for users that don't have a JIRA Core license placed, as they don't believe that they are able upgrade to JIRA 7.1.x.

Consequently, they don't actually click the "Download" button, and don't believe that there's an upgrade path to JIRA Service Desk 3.1.x or JIRA Software 7.1.x.

h3. Environment
* JIRA Software 7.0.10 with JIRA Service Desk 3.0.10, but JIRA Core does not have a license.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Access to *Versions & Licenses* page.

h3. Expected Results
The notification for JIRA Service Desk and JIRA Software should display a more appropriate and less confusing message regarding possible upgrade paths.

h3. Actual Results
The upgrade notification is confusing to some users.
fields.summary: Message "JIRA Core 7.1.x is now available" upgrade message is confusing

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-59924].
  {panel}

This bug is related to JRA-36670 which regards losing content while hitting the escape button. The resolution of JRA-36670 is a bit controversial, it has a resolution won't fix and explanation that it is "by design". However people report that they lose content while accidentally pressing the escape button.

This bug regards editing a description of an issue, and clicking File->Save Page As, or  pressing the keyboard shortcut ctrl-s. The dialog for choosing a file name appears. When clicking the cancel button a user returns to editing an issue, but while hitting the escape button instead, the dialog closes which is correct behavior, but simultaneously all updates to description are lost.
I think the escape button should have the action "close the dialog" and nothing else.

I have the habit of pressing ctrl-s, and after that pressing the escape button. Due to this I lose content very often.
fields.summary: Hitting Escape when editing an issue and displaying the 'save as' dialog losses content

h3. Problem Definition
In JQL, when a component is selected, all labels are shown where not all labels are related to the component.
h3. Suggested Solution
Allow users/admins to make filter dependable on each other
Example: When a Component is selected, limit the Label selections to only related labels.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-59915].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

When viewing a project that contains many issue types, and those issue types all have different field configurations, and those field configurations contain many issues the instance can run out of memory.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create an instance with many fields, field configurations and issue types and associate one project with those many field configurations
# View the field configuration page located at 'plugins/servlet/project-config/KEY/fields'

h3. Expected Results

Page loads

h3. Actual Results

h3. Notes

The instance may run out of memory if the page is viewed many times.

h3.Workaround

Consolidate field configurations as much as possible, i.e. map similar issue types to the same field configuration.
fields.summary: Out of memory error triggered by editing large field configuration for a project
Add documentation about worklogAuthor in Advanced Searching

h3. Problem Definition
After installing JIRA 7 and add the TimeSince gadget to a dashboard, we get the following warnings on the log each time the TimeSince gadget is refreshed. In case we have multiple TimeSince gadgets on the dashboard these warnings generates a lot of noise on the log.

{noformat}
2016-02-19 15:12:07,840 http-nio-8032-exec-2 WARN admin 912x1017x1 g2ksfs 192.168.10.122 /rest/gadget/1.0/timeSince/generate [c.s.j.s.container.servlet.WebComponent] A servlet request, to the URI http://quicksilver:8032/luciano-GHS33058/rest/gadget/1.0/timeSince/generate?projectOrFilterId=project-10000&periodName=daily&daysprevious=30&dateField=created&isCumulative=true&width=782&height=521&inline=true&_=1455901927829, contains form parameters in the request body but the request body has been consumed by the servlet or a servlet filter accessing the request parameters. Only resource methods using @FormParam will work as expected. Resource methods consuming the request body by other means will not work as expected.

Only resource methods using @FormParam will work as expected. Resource methods consuming the request body by other means will not work as expected.
{noformat}


h3. Suggested Solution
It would be great to be able to disable these WARNINGS on the log. Unfortunately it doesn't work by changing the logging level on the Logging & Profilling page for the classes: *com.sun.jersey.spi.container.servlet.WebComponent* & *com.sun.jersey.spi.container.servlet.WebComponent.filterFormParameters*

h3. Workaround
Change the logging level for the com.sun.jersey.spi.container.servlet.WebComponent class in the conf/logging.properties file by adding this line:
{code}
com.sun.jersey.spi.container.servlet.WebComponent.level = SEVERE
{code}
This will prevent the Warnings from being logged.

h3. Notes
Error is not triggered specifically for TimeSince gadget only

fields.description:
h3. Summary

After upgrading from JIRA 6.4.x / JIRA 7.0.10 to JIRA 7.1.0, gadgets title are showing as {{__MSG_gadget.xxxxxxx}}, {{__MSG_gadget.activity.}}, {{__MSG_gadget.filter}} and so on.

Please see the example below for how this appears in JIRA:
 !Selection_037.png|thumbnail!
h3. Environment
 * JIRA 7.1.0
 * Running JIRA over SSL/HTTPS

h3. Diagnosis

The following error appears in the {{atlassian-jira.log}}:
{noformat}
2016-02-26 14:22:28,843 http-bio-8443-exec-11 ERROR admin 862x395x1 m32d6k 172.22.37.40 /secure/MyJiraHome.jspa [c.a.g.r.internal.http.HttpClientFetcher] Unable to retrieve response
javax.net.ssl.SSLHandshakeException: sun.security.validator.ValidatorException: PKIX path building failed: sun.security.provider.certpath.SunCertPathBuilderException: unable to find valid certification path to requested target
	at sun.security.ssl.Alerts.getSSLException(Alerts.java:192)
{noformat}
h3. Steps to Reproduce

Configure JIRA to run over SSL/HTTPS using a self-signed certificate.
h3. Expected Results

Gadget title show correctly.
h3. Actual Results

Gadgets title keys are broken and appear as {{__MSG_gadget.xxxxxxx}}
h3. Workaround
 - If you are experiencing issues with a self-signed certificates then follow the steps found [here|https://confluence.atlassian.com/kb/ssl-and-application-link-troubleshooting-guide-719095282.html#SSLandApplicationLinkTroubleshootingGuide-Importacertificateintoatruststore] to import self-signed certificates.
 - If you are experiencing issues related to JIRA not trusting an internal or unknown certificate authority then follow the steps found [here|https://confluence.atlassian.com/kb/ssl-and-application-link-troubleshooting-guide-719095282.html#SSLandApplicationLinkTroubleshootingGuide-Importacertificateintoatruststore] for importing a certificate into the trust store to import the certificate authority certificate.
 - If you are experiencing issues related to gadgets and SNI(Server Name Indication) you should watch JRA-47568.
 - If you are experiencing a different problem than those listed above please open a support ticket at [https://support.atlassian.com/contact|https://support.atlassian.com/contact].

(i) Due to the number of workarounds involved, we've written a KB for this. Please review [How to fix gadget titles showing as __MSG_gadget.xxxxxxx|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/How+to+fix+gadget+titles+showing+as+__MSG_gadget] for the appropriate steps to take to workaround the issue.
{panel:title=Atlassian Update – 15 October 2018|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ebf2f9|titleBGColor=#ebf2f9|bgColor=#ffffff}
After a number of investigations, this is not a valid bug, instead, this is an issue towards the configuration on proxy that need to be updated as the structure for retrieving the gadget title have changed since JIRA 7.1 and above. Proceed to the [How to fix gadget titles showing as __MSG_gadget.xxxxxxx|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/How+to+fix+gadget+titles+showing+as+__MSG_gadget] for the fix
{panel}

h3. Summary
The JQLs in {{Project Summary >> Statistics}} view is broken. 

h3. Environment
JIRA 7.1.0

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Install JIRA 7.1.0 
# Create a few issues
# Navigate to Project Summary and change the view to Statistics
# Click on any of the filters 
!statistics.png|thumbnail!

h3. Expected Results
JQLs are showing the correct results in Issue Navigator

h3. Actual Results
All links refer to blank searches {{<baseURL>/issues/}}

fields.description:
h3. Summary.

A deadlock possible on JIRA startup if a 401 / 403 response is returned when PICO is not fully initialised. 

This is because the page displayed on that response code {{displayError.jsp}} assumes the PICO container is up and attempts to retrieve components from it in an unsafe way. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce.

* Start JIRA.
* Immediately after, attempt to navigate to {{displayError.jsp}} or /display-error before PICO is up.

h3. Actual Results
* A deadlock will occur on the PICO container.

h3. Expected Results

* The error page is displayed succesfully.

h3. Workaround

* Block requests to JIRA at the apache level until it has been fully started.

h3. Notes

Please verify that {{DisplayErrorServlet}} does not have any unsafe usages of PICO either.
fields.summary: Deadlock possible on JIRA startup if a 401 / 403 response is returned when PICO is not fully initialised

{code}
Unfortunately no connection was possible. Review the errors below and rectify:
AuthenticationFailedException: 534-5.7.9 Application-specific password required. Learn more at 534 5.7.9 https://support.google.com/accounts/answer/185833 by3sm13205108pab.39 - gsmtp
{code}

In atlassian-jira.log at the same time:
{code}
2016-02-19 10:11:00,367 http-nio-8787-exec-6 ERROR sam 610x307x1 aqhz1w 0:0:0:0:0:0:0:1 /secure/admin/VerifySmtpServerConnection!add.jspa [c.a.j.p.mail.webwork.VerifyMailServer] Unable to connect to the server at smtp.gmail.com due to the following exception: javax.mail.AuthenticationFailedException: 534-5.7.9 Application-specific password required. Learn more at
    534 5.7.9  https://support.google.com/accounts/answer/185833 by3sm13205108pab.39 - gsmtp
{code}

h3. Steps To Reproduce
# Enable 2-Step Verification for your Gmail account
# Set up your SMTP (outgoing mail) with the Gamil account

Test Connection and Test mail should result in success

Both tests fail

Referring to the link at https://support.google.com/accounts/answer/185833 asks to enable app password. 
Setting up Custom app password, makes you enable to have successful connection test once.

AuthenticationFailedException: 535-5.7.8 Username and Password not accepted. Learn more at 535 5.7.8 https://support.google.com/mail/answer/14257 xu1sm13243659pab.31 - gsmtp

fields.description:
h3. Summary

We are currently on 8.0.17 and have already been bitten by a bug in it:

https://bz.apache.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=57476

We should upgrade to the latest to get the latest bugfixes.

Also,  there have been a number of recent CVEs involving Tomcat, most of which involve SecurityManager, which I believe we do not currently use.

http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2015-5174
http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2016-0706
http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2016-0714
http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2016-0763

However, these are related to other aspects of Tomcat:

http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2015-5345
http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2015-5346
http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2015-5351 (probably doesn't affect us)

Updating Tomcat to one of these versions would appear to patch all of the above CVEs:

* Apache Tomcat 9.0.0.M3
* Apache Tomcat 8.0.32
* Apache Tomcat 7.0.68
* Apache Tomcat 6.0.45
fields.summary: Upgrade Tomcat to the latest 8.0.x release

fields.description:
h3. Summary

In the Issue Navigator: List View, a user can designate a set of columns under *My Defaults*, which are the columns displayed for standard searches. The user can also designate a set of columns under *Filter*, which are specific to each saved Filter.

When a user initially runs a filter search, they can select to use the *Filter* columns to see specific columns for that particular filter. However, if this user changes the JQL and runs it, the current view will still show the *Filter* specific columns, instead of showing the *My Defaults* columns instead.

Whether this is by design or not is uncertain. However, this will directly conflict with the implementation of [Exporting to Excel (Current fields)|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jira/exporting-search-results-to-microsoft-excel-185729538.html], which should *... create a spreadsheet column for the issue fields that are currently displayed in your Issue Navigator.*

What will actually happen is that the export will contain the columns under *My Defaults*, even though what is onscreen will be from the columns under *Filter*.

h3. Environment
Reproduced up to JIRA 7.0.9

h3. Steps to Reproduce
1. When viewing list of issues from a specific filter (e.g. ExampleFilter), add a new column value. This value:
* Should not be present in the *My Defaults* option.
* Needs to be added to the *Filter* option.

2. Modify the JQL, and then run it, so that we are looking at a different result set (but are now *editing* ExampleFilter)

3. Export as *Excel (Current Fields)*

h3. Expected Results

The export should contain all fields in the current view, which is still the *Filter* view.

h3. Actual Results
The export will include all columns from the *My Defaults* option, rather than what is onscreen at the time.
 
h3. Notes
This properly explains the behavior described in [JRA-36991 : Export to Excel (Current Fields) not using the fields on screen if a filter has been edited|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-36991], which did not have clear repro steps and was confused with [JRA-34812 : Export to excel (current fields) does not show all columns present in the issue navigator|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-34812], which did not address the issue.

h3.Workaround

Either:
* Save every JQL modification as a new or existing filter, and ensure that the column(s) being added are added to the *Filter* set
* Add the column(s) to the *My Defaults* set prior to exporting.
fields.summary: Issue Navigator should show Default columns if Filter JQL is changed

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-59878].
  {panel}

On a JIRA Cloud instance, when you export searched issues to Excel, the column belonging to any date fields displays results in two different formats for the same column, depending on the month:

*dd/MMM/yyyy* (ie: 17/Jan/2016)
* January
* April
* August
* December

*dd/MM/yyyy* (ie: 15/02/2016)
* February
* March
* May
* June
* July
* September
* October
* November

It would be desirable to have them all in the same format, preferably yyyy-MM-dd (ie: 2016/01/23).
fields.summary: Mixed date formats exported to Excel

h3. Summary
When JIRA Core is running on a commercial license and JIRA Servicedesk is installed on the instance, the footer for the instance changes to "Powered by a free Atlassian JIRA evaluation license. Please consider purchasing it today."



h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Install JIRA Core over commercial license
# Add JIRA Servicedesk application using trial(evaluation) license 
# Notice that the JIRA footer (for all screens reads) : "Powered by a free Atlassian JIRA evaluation license. Please consider purchasing it today."

h3. Expected Results
The footer would change only for Servicedesk screens.


h3. Actual Results
The footer gets changed for all screens.
fields.summary: As a user the footer on JIRA shown incorrectly even when JIRA Core is on commercial license : "Powered by a free Atlassian JIRA evaluation license. Please consider purchasing it today"

fields.description:
We're currently using search() method from your com.atlassian.jira.bc.issue.search.SearchService. Because of changes introduced in JIRA 7.1 we're experiencing problems when doing simple queries in the form "project = key". 
In such cases, the result is a nice exception thrown as following: 
{code}
Caused by: java.lang.NullPointerException
at com.atlassian.jira.instrumentation.DefaultInstrumentationListenerManager.getCurrentTraceId(DefaultInstrumentationListenerManager.java:200)
at com.atlassian.jira.issue.search.providers.DualSearchProvider.recordMetrics(DualSearchProvider.java:169)
at com.atlassian.jira.issue.search.providers.DualSearchProvider.performSearch(DualSearchProvider.java:138)
at com.atlassian.jira.issue.search.providers.DualSearchProvider.search(DualSearchProvider.java:79)
at com.atlassian.jira.bc.issue.search.DefaultSearchService.search(DefaultSearchService.java:111)
at com.keplerrominfo.sil.lang.AbstractRoutine.execute(AbstractRoutine.java:78)
at com.keplerrominfo.sil.lang.grammar.ASTCallNode.interpret(ASTCallNode.java:72)
... 18 more
{code}

Surprisingly, 
{code}
"summary is not EMPTY and project = key"
{code}
 works, however 
{code}
"project = key and summary is not EMPTY" 
{code} does not work, the result is the same exception (shown above).
Although the problem is not in the service itself, the class to blame is DefaultInstrumentationListenerManager, which introduced a new ThreadLocal variable requestData with the purpose of recording statistics.

We, at Kepler-Rominfo, consider this a bug because queries should be symmetric and should work even if the execution of the query is on another thread than the one that initiated the call.

Plus, we do not consider that every service call coresponds to a real web request (our case, most of the time). Using DefaultInstrumentationListenerManager.startContext() on our own thread doesn't seem appropriate. 

The same problem manifests when using search() method from SearchProvider.
fields.summary: JQL Filter fails when query is "project = key"

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-59874].
  {panel}

*As a* JIRA Cloud Administrator, 
*I would like* each addon to be easier to find, enable and configure it from a unique page integrated on my JIRA Cloud instance, and that its URL were generic,
*so that I can* easily find, enable and configure it, as well as share the URL anywhere.

Currently, addons can be difficult to find and have their configuration pages separated from where they can be found as search results.

This is causing admins not being able to find addons they want to install (ie: [this Atlassian Answers Question|https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/36189010/answers/36189161/comments/36604523]).
fields.summary: Make addons easier to browse

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-59871].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

After connecting JIRA to SSL or HTTP as per 
* https://confluence.atlassian.com/jira/running-jira-over-ssl-or-https-124008.html

Old urls for filters and issues that are still using the HTTP protocol is not properly redirected to HTTPS.

When trying to access those HTTP or non SSL urls for the filters or issues 
* User is logged out of JIRA
* Page not redirected to the new HTTPS link as it should. 

h3. Suggested Solution
Adding :
{code}
<url-pattern>/issues/*</url-pattern>
{code}

to the  <web-resource-collection> on the {{web.xml}} file. This is not documented on  :
* https://confluence.atlassian.com/jira/running-jira-over-ssl-or-https-124008.html

It would be great if this documentation is updated to :
{code}
<security-constraint>
  <web-resource-collection>
    <web-resource-name>all-except-attachments</web-resource-name>
    <url-pattern>*.jsp</url-pattern>
    <url-pattern>*.jspa</url-pattern>
    <url-pattern>/browse/*</url-pattern>
    <url-pattern>/issues/*</url-pattern>
  </web-resource-collection>
  <user-data-constraint>
    <transport-guarantee>CONFIDENTIAL</transport-guarantee>
  </user-data-constraint>
</security-constraint>
{code}
fields.summary: Documentation : Filter and Issues page not redirected after integrating JIRA with SSL or HTTPS

h3. Summary
During a JIRA import, if the export is from a JIRA that has a pending upgrade task in the database, this entry is migrated and causes the JIRA Upgrade task (after the import) to fail and permanently Lock JIRA.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
Upgrade Tasks may appear as "Pending" in the *upgradehistory* db table if the DelayedUpgradeJobRunner introduced in JIRA 6.4 delayed the task.
# Export a JIRA that has a "Pending" task in the *upgradehistory* table.
# Import to latest JIRA

h3. Expected Results
JIRA imports and runs upgrade tasks

h3. Actual Results
*Update: 7/7/2016* - JIRA will allow the export, but will raise a validation error before beginning to import the backup file. This should allow the workaround to be applied directly and the import restarted.

I found the following entry on the entities.xml
{noformat}
JIRA is locked.

h3. Notes
On that particular case the following entry is found in the "entities.xml"
{noformat}
<UpgradeHistory id="10639" upgradeclass="com.atlassian.jira.upgrade.tasks.UpgradeTask_Build64016" targetbuild="64016" status="pending"/>
{noformat}
The export was from a JIRA build 64016

h3.Workaround
* Search for the UpgradeTask_Build number in the entities.xml
* If it is in "Pending" status, remove the entry and any other "Pending" tasks.
* Recover JIRA and import again
fields.summary: Import fails if the export contains upgrade task "Pending" in the upgrade history

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Even though users who don't have *Assignable User* permission, the users can be assigned to issues when creating issues in the case *Reporter* was set to *Assignable Users*. Additionally, similar behaviors can be observed when using either the *User Custom Field value* or *Group Custom Field value*- however, when using these values, users without permission will only be suggested, but cannot be used to create the issue.
This symptom can be seen only when creating issues. (When it comes to editing issues, there is no violation.)

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a project
# Set *Reporter*, *User Custom Field value*, or *Group Custom Field value* to *Assignable Users* in the Permission Scheme of the project
 !permission.png|thumbnail! 
# Assign the user without permission when creating an issue

h3. Expected Results
The users who doesn't have *Assignable Users* permission shouldn't be shown in the suggestion of assignee and he issue creation should be failed.

h3. Actual Results
The users who doesn't have *Assignable Users* permission was shown in the suggestion and the issue was able to created if *Reporter* was used.
 !create_issue.png|thumbnail!  

h3. Notes
* Even if the users who created issues doesn't have *Modify Reporter* permission, this problem occurred
* This problem didn't occur in 6.4.x and the earlier versions
* When we search Assignable users with [the REST API|https://docs.atlassian.com/jira/REST/latest/#api/2/user-findAssignableUsers], non assignable users are also shown as the result of the API
fields.summary: "Assignable User" permission violation when creating issues

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-59866].
  {panel}

h5. Experienced Behavior:

After creating a project the Default Issue Type Scheme is not automatically updated to include issue types created during project creation. 
* The Default Issue Type Scheme must include all issue types. These types not being included in the Default Issue Type Scheme causes errors when performing actions in JIRA

h5. Expected Behavior:

All issue types are added to Default Issue Type Scheme when the issue types are added to JIRA. The description of this scheme indicates it should be automatically updated.
** "Default issue type scheme is the list of global issue types. All newly created issue types will automatically be added to this scheme."

h5. Steps to Reproduce:

# Start with new JIRA 7 instance
# Install JIRA Software 
#* Notice two issue types (epic, story) are created automatically and appear in the Default Issue Type Scheme.
# Create new JIRA Software project
#* Notice that new issue types have been created and a new issue type scheme has been created for that project. This new scheme contains the issue types defined in the project template. 
#* The default issue type scheme is not updated to include the issue types that were added during project creation.

h5. Workaround:

* JIRA Server
Follow the instructions in [this KB|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/Unable+to+move+issue+to+another+Issue+Type+due+to+%27The+issue+type+selected+is+invalid%27+error] to add the issue types to the scheme

* JIRA Cloud
Open a support ticket at [Atlassian Support|https://support.atlassian.com] to have those issue types added.
fields.summary: Default Issue Type Scheme not updated when Issue types are added during project creation

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-59863].
  {panel}

JIRA client should have Ajax (asynchronous JavaScript and XML) callbacks for ticket updates, specifically for comments and assignees.
While we are browsing through a JIRA ticket, we often keep one page per JIRA while working on other issues or viewing other JIRA tickets in other browser tabs/windows.
It looks like JIRA does not have Ajax support as of now. And since it doesn't update the existing page with Ajax callbacks, often times we lose track of the latest comments made by others, while we're writing a comment or viewing a JIRA ticket. This can lead to confusing inconveniences because of the race conditions that take place between the last refresh timestamp of the page and submitting a new comment or change for the ticket.
This use case is particularly important while we are dealing with Escalation issues (i.e. CPSDEVESC) that sometimes requires almost immediate notification on the currently while we're working on the currently open windows.
While comment Ajax refresh functionality is the most important aspect, it would be also a non-trivial benefit if JIRA pages can support Ajax callbacks for any and all updates on any field on the page (e.g. type, description, assignee).
Without this feature, we constantly have to refresh all the pages for all the jira tickets that are open in our browsers, which makes it impossible to get the latest update feed once we start to write a comment, since we can not refresh the page while writing a comment or making a change on one part of the ticket.
fields.summary: JIRA client should have Ajax callbacks for ticket updates, specifically for comments and assignees.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
User can set Issue Security to any level if the issue security level has User Custom Field Value or/and Group Custom Field Value assigned.


h3. Steps to Reproduce
1. Create a new project (any type) 'Phoenix'.
2) Create a new user 'felix', make sure the 'jira-users' group is the only group 'felix' is added to, and only the Project Role - Users is assigned to 'felix'.
3) Create a new group called 'legendary', create a new user called 'kurt' and add him into the group.
3) Grant *Edit Issue* and *Set Issue Security* project permission to 'felix' in Phoenix project.
4) Create new custom fields below, associate to the Create Issue and Edit Issue screen in Phoenix project.

{noformat}
- Type: Group Picker (single group)
- Name: Team

- Type: User Picker (single user)
- Name: Who
- Filter: group 'legendary' only
{noformat}


5) For Phoenix project, create a new Issue Security Scheme called 'Tron' with Security Levels as per screenshot below. 
 !securityLvl.PNG|thumbnail! 

*Test 1:*
a) As an admin or any other user than 'felix', create an issue in the Phoenix project, set the Team to 'legendary'.
b) In another browser, log in as 'felix'. Edit the issue created in a) to set a Security Level.

*Test 2:*
i) As an admin or any other user than 'felix', create an issue in the Phoenix project, set the Who to 'kurt'.
ii) In another browser, log in as 'felix'. Edit the issue created in i) to set a Security Level.

h3. Expected Results
'felix' does not belong to group 'legendary' and he's not in the Administrator project role, he should not be able to see and set the level to L1.
'felix' does not belong to group 'legendary' and he's not the Project Lead, he should not be able to see and set the level to L2.
'felix' is not in the Developers project role, he should not be able to see and set the level to L3.


h3. Actual Results
'felix' can see and set the Issue Security level to L1 and L2 (not as expected), but not L3 (as expected).
The Issue Security level is *not* respecting the value of Group Custom field and User Custom Field.


h3.Workaround
n/a
fields.summary: User can set Issue Security to any level if the issue security level has User Custom Field Value or/and Group Custom Field Value assigned

fields.description: When changing the ordering of a post function (or editing one) in a workflow, after doing that, instead of remaining on the Post Functions tab, it gets reset to the Triggers tab such a reselection of Post Functions tab (again) is required for however many steps are required.  7.0.9 didn't do this.  No javascript console errors.
fields.summary: Post function ordering or updates resets UI focus to Triggers tab

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-59856].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently when you click on the edit button of an issue. Then JIRA retrieves the fields and values of the field and after a user makes a modification, then all the fields of the relevant tables are updated. This could be an issue if we have two users who simultaneously open the edit, where the first user makes a change like removing a label and submits the change. However, then later the second user makes a change to another field and submits. As in his submission the label is still included, therefore the label field will be re-added.  

h3. Suggested Solution
Therefore we would like a mechanism where only modified fields are updated instead of all the fields.
fields.summary: As a user, I want the issue edit option to update the database based on the exact field changed rather than all fields retrieved

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Web Sudo/Authentication is not triggered when accessing to add-on configuration page via URL
* Impacting user with group assigned to JIRA Administrator permission
* Users who's assigned as JIRA User is not impacted (wont be able to access the page directly with URL)


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Install *any* add-on, for example, jira subversion plugin
# Once install, access to the plugin configuration page directly using URL :http://localhost:8080/secure/ViewSubversionRepositories.jspa

h3. Expected Results
WebSudo/Authentication should be triggered and user need to enter credential
 !Selection_031.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results
No authentication needed

h3. Notes
However, clicking any other JIRA's admin functionality will trigger the WebSudo again
fields.summary: Web Sudo/Authentication is not triggered when accessing to add-on configuration page via URL

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-59852].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

Normally you get an JSON from the REST API, no matter if it's an error or a success with data. This isn't the case when i successfully upload an image via multipart. The Jira API returns an textarea with the "success" JSON inside:

For example:
!image001.png! 

h3. Suggested Solution
 
It would be great when an avatar is successfully uploaded in JIRA via REST API, it will be returning a meaningful success or error JSON data instead of a meaningless result.
fields.summary: REST API Avatar improvement
